data.title: Five Celebs you forgot were once married to each other
data.meta_description: George Clooney and Talia Balsam got married in 1989, but the actors divorced in 1993. Actors Mimi Rogers and Tom Cruise got married in a secret ceremony in 1987, and divorced in 1990. Singer-songwriter Lyle Lovett and actress Julia Roberts wed in 1993. Their divorce was finalized less than two…
data.text:
Jason Alexander would like to be included in this narrative

???

It's Britney, bitch 💍

the julia roberts one still confuses me.

ok, I used to think so, but he's so talented! I can kind of see how he could be super charming, but when you're courting america's sweetheart and so incredibly famous, it's just not enough to make it last imo.

plus, he's tall, so we know that has an effect.

Edited at 2020-12-30 06:13 pm (UTC)

He looks better as an older man.

I saw him play live a few times, he's incredible. Very dry sense of humour too. One-Eyed Fiona (JR's middle name) gives a bit of insight into their relationship btw (including the line 'her brother won't like you, he just might bite you').

Julia was like a serial Casanova-type when her career first blew up. It’s actually pretty impressive. https://www.yahoo.com/news/a-look-back-to-when-julia-roberts-called-off-her-170552333.html

Alex Kingston and Ralph Fiennes

She still holds a grudge against him too, lol

Good for her.

good

this is the weirdest thing because i could've sworn i read somewhere that some of the lyrics to Radiohead's Life in a Glasshouse were inspired by her dealing with the paparazzi after the divorce (covering the windows with newspaper clippings) but I CAN NOT FIND ANYTHING ABOUT IT ANYWHERE

did i make that up lmao

i swear that was the only reason i knew they were even married

Lol, I’m so old that I forgot they broke up 25 years ago. I remember when they were the it couple of British film and theatre and how shocking it was when they broke up. She traded way up, though.

I think because they were in Much Ado About Nothing, fans of that movie remember the marriage. Myself included, I love that movie.

(no subject) - crimps4 Expand

they make so much sense as a couple lol shame that he’s an ass

They worked on lots of things together when they were married. The cheating/break up was a huge deal.

Emma upgraded to Greg Wise though, she's the real winner here.

Omg i was a huge fan of both (and their general circle of actor friends, i.e. the cast of “Peter’s Friends”) and haven’t been able to stand seeing any of his movies since. My high school even had a Kenneth Branagh and Emma Thompson fan club (back in the early 90s) and we were all devastated when they broke up.

(no subject) - sisterruth Expand

I read the Daily Express all through my late 80s early 90s childhood and they will always be Ken & Em to me. The Express had a FIELD DAY when Ken hooked up with Helena Bonham Carter - it was referenced on every page of that day's issue including the cartoon and probably Beachcomber.

Disclaimer: The Daily Express was and is trash

I just watched Much Ado About Nothing for the first time recently and their chemistry was off the charts.. they were married at the time. It was a fun movie.. really enjoyed it.

Also, it blows my mind that he's the same guy in Wild Wild West who plays the evil Loveless. I knew he looked familiar!!

I don't watch Dead Again too often, but when I do I spend several moments hating him for their divorce.

i only know about this because as a child anytime i watched harry potter my mom would always say "lockhart and trelawney were married in real life"

Emma seems so lovely, the story about how she threatened to leave a movie after hearing that an executive told Hayley Atwell she needed to lose weight was such a power move. Kenneth comes off as such a narcissist by always casting himself as leads in all of his movies lmao.

Emma. What on god's green earth is on your head?!

i remember this only because of her saying that scene in love actually where she breaks down was easy to film

My mom always tells a story about how I found a magazine cover with Julia Roberts and that guy on it and asked her a bunch of questions about it. I finally got frustrated and shouted "but how can pretty girls marry ugly boys?!"

Asking the important questions, tbh!!

I remember Lyle Lovett and Julia Roberts as a kid because my mom was always like,

when she saw them together lol

most energy she ever spent on Julia Roberts until her scandal~

Edited at 2020-12-30 05:34 pm (UTC)

Unrelated, but wow he's had a lot of work done.

I was living at home when they got married. My mom loved to drop news on me to wake me up. This bit went:

*knock, knock*

“Sweetie, wake up. Oh, and Julia Roberts got married.”

**mumble, mumble**

“That’s nice.” (Almost back to sleep)

“To Lyle Lovett.”

I sat up straight in bed and said, “What the fuck!”
